body: All submissions for this problem are available.You are playing a game called _Martingale_. The rules of the game are as follows: ``` 1. At the beginning of the game, you are given $N$ as input. 2. Set $V = N$, and set $X = 1$ 3. Flip a fair coin. 3a. If the coin lands on heads: Increase $V$ by $X$, and then set $X = 1$ 3b. If the coin lands on tails: Decrease $V$ by $X$, and then set $X = 2X$ 4. If $V$ less than or equal to $0$ or $V$ greater than or equal to $2N$ 4a. End the game. 5. Proceed to step 3. ``` ------------ Given the initial value $N$, what is the expected number of turns (coin flips) you will play before ending the game? ###Input: Input consists of a single integer, $N$ (with $1 \leq N \leq 1,000,000$), the initial input to the game. ###Output: A single decimal number, containing the expected number of turns you will play this game before it ends. Your output will be accepted if it is within $10^{-6}$ absolute or relative error. ###Sample Input 1: ``` 1 ``` ###Sample Output 1: ``` 1.000000000000 ``` ###Sample Input 2: ``` 3 ``` ###Sample Output 2: ``` 3.9609375 ```
